description: This introduction to dance allows students broadly to experience and learn about dance.  Students
explore dance from the following perspectives: historical, cultural and social, creative and
expressive, performing, critical and aesthetic, and kinesthetic.  Lectures, experiential movement
labs, group presentations, and viewing of both live and recorded dance performances are all
components of the course. No dance experience required.  Ticket/transportation fee required.
Offered annually in the fall semester.
